name: ElectricalProtection
title: Electrical Protection
description: Electrical Protection codes for insurance operations.

concept.definition: A device that protects electrical systems and equipment from voltage spikes caused by lightning strikes by diverting the excess current to ground.
A metal rod mounted on a structure to intercept lightning strikes and conduct the electrical charge safely to ground, protecting the building from fire and structural damage.
A device that protects electrical circuits from transient voltage surges by limiting the voltage and diverting surge current away from sensitive equipment.

designation.value: Disjoncteur de Fuite à la Terre

concept.definition: A device that monitors the flow of electrical current and quickly shuts off power when it detects an imbalance between incoming and outgoing current, preventing electrical shock.
A device that detects dangerous electrical arcing in wiring and immediately interrupts the circuit to prevent electrical fires.
An automatically operated electrical switch that protects an electrical circuit from damage caused by overcurrent or short circuit by interrupting the flow of electricity.
